metadata.title: CVE-2022-24809 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
net-snmp: A malformed OID in a GET-NEXT to the nsVacmAccessTable can cause a NULL pointer dereference.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24809` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetsnmptrapd40 - 5.9.1+dfsg-4ubuntu2
libsnmp-base - 5.9.1+dfsg-4ubuntu2
libsnmp-perl - 5.9.1+dfsg-4ubuntu2
libsnmp40 - 5.9.1+dfsg-4ubuntu2
snmp - 5.9.1+dfsg-4ubuntu2
snmpd - 5.9.1+dfsg-4ubuntu2
snmptrapd - 5.9.1+dfsg-4ubuntu2
tkmib - 5.9.1+dfsg-4ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.9.1+dfsg-4ubuntu2').
